directions: Coarsely chop celery and carrot and quarter onion. In a large, deep saucepan bring broth and water to a boil with celery, carrot, onion, neck, and giblets, skimming froth. Add remaining ingredients and cook, uncovered, at a bare simmer 2 hours, or until liquid is reduced to about 6 cups. Pour stock through a fine sieve into a bowl. Stock may be made 2 days ahead and cooled completely, uncovered, before being chilled or frozen in an airtight container.
ingredients: neck and giblets (excluding liver) from a 12-to-14 pound turkey
8 sprigs mixed fresh herbs such as thyme, sage, rosemary, and/or marjoram
title: Turkey Giblet Stock
